description: A former government research facility island in the New World that was permanently transformed by the ten-day battle between Admirals Akainu and Aokiji. One half is perpetually frozen while the other burns eternally.

keyEvents.title: Punk Hazard's Environmental Transformation Revealed
keyEvents.description: Jinbe explains that Punk Hazard was permanently altered by the ten-day battle between Akainu and Aokiji, with one half frozen and the other burning.
keyEvents.significance: First mention of Punk Hazard and foreshadowing of the Punk Hazard arc. Demonstrates the destructive power of Admiral-level Devil Fruit battles.

historicalSignificance: Site of the legendary battle between Admirals Akainu and Aokiji that determined the next Fleet Admiral. The island serves as physical evidence of Devil Fruit awakening's environmental effects.

description: The royal palace of the Ryugu Kingdom on Fish-Man Island, home to King Neptune and his family. The palace is where celebrations are held and state secrets are discussed.

keyEvents.title: Neptune Reveals Shirahoshi is Poseidon
keyEvents.description: At the palace, Neptune confides in Robin that Shirahoshi is the Ancient Weapon Poseidon.
keyEvents.significance: The palace serves as the location for one of the most important revelations in the series.

keyEvents.title: Caribou's Kidnapping Attempt
keyEvents.description: Caribou attempts to kidnap Shirahoshi from the palace after overhearing her secret.
keyEvents.significance: The palace's security is breached, demonstrating the vulnerability of even royal locations.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Kicks Caribou from Palace Tower
keyEvents.description: Luffy kicks Caribou from the palace tower, sending him flying back to Fish-Man Island.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the palace's height and Luffy's protective nature.

historicalSignificance: The royal seat of the Ryugu Kingdom and home to the current Poseidon, one of the three Ancient Weapons.

description: An underwater island located 10,000 meters below sea level, serving as a gateway to the New World. The island is the homeland of fish-men and merfolk.

keyEvents.title: Pekoms and Tamago Arrive for Candy Tribute
keyEvents.description: Members of the Big Mom Pirates arrive at Fish-Man Island to collect the monthly candy payment.
keyEvents.significance: Sets up the conflict that leads to Luffy declaring war on Big Mom.

keyEvents.title: Hody Jones Imprisoned and Aged
keyEvents.description: Hody and his crew are shown imprisoned on Fish-Man Island, suffering from rapid aging due to Energy Steroid side effects.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates the consequences of Hody's actions and the island's justice system.

historicalSignificance: Home to the Ancient Weapon Poseidon and the massive ship Noah. The island has historical connections to Joy Boy and the Void Century.
